measure.CatchLine: Establishes Task Force on Resilient Efficient Buildings and specifies task force membership.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Establishes Task Force on Resilient Efficient Buildings and specifies task force membership. Requires task force to identify and evaluate policies related to building codes and building decarbonization for new and existing buildings that would enable state to meet greenhouse gas emissions reduction goals while maximizing other benefits. Requires task force to make policy recommendations for legislation to interim committees of Legislative Assembly related to environment before 2023 regular session of Legislative Assembly. 
	Declares emergency, effective on passage.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to building codes; and declaring an emergency.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to building codes; and declaring an emergency.
measure.AtTheRequestOf: (at the request of Senate Interim Committee on Energy and Environment)

sponsors.PresessionFiledMessage: Printed pursuant to Senate Interim Rule 213.28 by order of the President of the Senate in conformance with presession filing rules, indicating neither advocacy nor opposition on the part of the President.

historyActions.ActionText: Introduction and first reading. Referred to President's desk.
Recommendation: Do pass with amendments and be referred to Ways and Means. (Printed A-Eng.)
Referred to Ways and Means by order of the President.
Assigned to Subcommittee On General Government.
Recommendation: Do pass with amendments to the A-Eng. bill.  (Printed B-Eng.)
Third reading.  Carried by Lieber.  Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 19; Nays, 7--Findley, Girod, Hansell, Knopp, Linthicum, Thatcher, Thomsen; Absent, 1--Heard; Excused, 3--Boquist, Frederick, Robinson.

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Third reading. Carried by Marsh. Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 36; Nays, 21--Bonham, Breese-Iverson, Cate, George, Goodwin, Hayden, Hieb, Levy, Lewis, Moore-Green, Morgan, Noble, Owens, Reschke, Smith DB, Smith G, Stark, Wallan, Weber, Wright, Zika; Excused, 2--Boshart Davis, Scharf; Excused for Business of the House, 1--Kropf.
